CVE-2024-32896
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2024-06-14T12:43:33.113000

23 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T14:53:48.367Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog (link might not work)
Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

#KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_26169 #CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_32896 #CISA #zeroday

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T18:26:46.713Z ##

Google Pixel Zero Day: Pixel Update Bulletin—June 2024
CVE-2024-32896 (high severity) Elevation of Privilege
References: A-324321147
Subcomponent: Pixel Firmwire

Note: There are indications that CVE-2024-32896 may be under limited, targeted exploitation.

EDIT 13 June 2024: CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

#CVE_2024_32896 #zeroday #vulnerability #Pixel #cve #eitw #activeexploitation

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T18:26:46.000Z ##

Google Pixel Zero Day: Pixel Update Bulletin—June 2024
CVE-2024-32896 (high severity) Elevation of Privilege
References: A-324321147
Subcomponent: Pixel Firmwire

Note: There are indications that CVE-2024-32896 may be under limited, targeted exploitation.

EDIT 13 June 2024: CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

#CVE_2024_32896 #zeroday #vulnerability #Pixel #cve #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T03:13:46.513Z ##

@Ongion in looking up "Pixel firmwire" I came across a website that lists completely incorrect information for CVE-2024-32896: https://www.zero-day.cz/database/891/

CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:H/RL:O/RC:C

I plugged it into a calculator and the CVSSv3.1 base score is 7.8 high severity, and the temporal is 7.5. I don't know where they got that information from. They also claim that the CWE is "CWE-20 - Improper input validation"

I just checked NVD again: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32896#VulnChangeHistorySection

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T15:58:35.754Z ##

@jgreig According to GrapheneOS, CVE-2024-32896 is the 2nd part of the fix for the CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies: https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112609239806949074 h/t @caspicat cc: @jwarminsky

And that CVE-2024-32896 is not Pixel-specific

##
caspicat at 2024-06-13T15:46:19.399Z ##

@screaminggoat
Note CVE-2024-32896 is not Pixel specific according GrapheneOS thread https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112609239806949074

##
AAKL at 2024-06-13T15:15:16.373Z ##

New listings on #CISA. #cybersecurity #infosec #Google

KEV catalogue:

- CVE-2024-32896 (patched): #Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32896

- CVE-2024-26169: #Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-26169

(More info: Microsoft on CVE-2024-26169: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-26169)

- CVE-2024-4358: Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4358

- Siemens SCALANCE W700 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-165-12
- Siemens TIA Administrator https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-165-03
- Siemens SIMATIC S7-200 SMART Devices https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-165-02

AAKL at 2024-06-13T14:57:15.517Z ##

If you missed this, #Google has patched an actively exploited zero-day in the #Pixel Firmware - CVE-2024-32896 https://securityaffairs.com/164500/security/google-fixed-pixel-firmware-zero-day.html @securityaffairs #cybersecurity #infosec

##
jbhall56 at 2024-06-13T12:05:24.055Z ##

The high-severity vulnerability, tagged as CVE-2024-32896, has been described as an elevation of privilege issue in Pixel Firmware. https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/google-warns-of-pixel-firmware-security.html

##
ottoto2017@prattohome.com at 2024-06-13T08:21:32.000Z ##

「 #Google 、#ゼロデイ として悪用された #Pixel #ファームウェア のセキュリティ欠陥について警告 」： The Hacker News

「Googleは 、Pixelファームウェアに影響を与えるセキュリティ上の欠陥がゼロデイとして悪用されていると 警告した。

CVE-2024-32896 としてタグ付けされた重大度の高い #脆弱性 は、 Pixel ファームウェアの #権限昇格 の問題として説明されています。

同社は、 #CVE-2024-32896 を悪用する攻撃の性質に関する追加の詳細は明らかにしなかったが、「CVE-2024-32896が限定的かつ標的を絞った悪用を受けている可能性がある兆候がある」と述べた。

2024 年 6 月の #セキュリティ #更新 プログラムは、合計 50 件のセキュリティ脆弱性に対処しており、そのうち 5 件はクアルコム チップセットのさまざまなコンポーネントに関連しています。
サイバーセキュリティ」

https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/google-warns-of-pixel-firmware-security.html

#prattohome #TheHackerNews

##

CVE-2024-37280
(4.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T22:03:51

2 posts

A flaw was discovered in Elasticsearch, affecting document ingestion when an index template contains a dynamic field mapping of “passthrough” type. Under certain circumstances, ingesting documents in this index would cause a StackOverflow exception to be thrown and ultimately lead to a Denial of Service. Note that passthrough fields is an experimental feature.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T10:56:43.762Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elasticsearch 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-14)
CVE-2024-37280 (4.9 medium) Elasticsearch StackOverflow causes Denial of Service. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_37280 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T10:56:43.000Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Elasticsearch 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-14)
CVE-2024-37280 (4.9 medium) Elasticsearch StackOverflow causes Denial of Service. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_37280 #Elastic #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-5924
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T21:30:59

2 posts

Dropbox Desktop Folder Sharing Mark-of-the-Web Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-of-the-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of Dropbox Desktop. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the handling of shared fol

##

CVE-2024-30058
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-13T21:30:58

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T20:29:06.196Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) dropped 21 security advisories related to Microsoft Edge and Chromium-based vulnerabilities. For convenience, I will not link all of the ones already disclosed by Google Chrome from 11 June 2024 (see parent toot above). Instead, I will list the new ones:

  • CVE-2024-30057 (CVSS:3.1 5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge for iOS Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-30058 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38083 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

The other CVEs match those disclosed by Google on Tuesday. None of the above Microsoft Edge-specific vulnerabilities were marked as publicly disclosed or exploited. None of Google Chrome's CVEs were noted to have an exploit in the wild either.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #Chrome #Chromium #Edge #CVE_2024_30057 #CVE_2024_30058 #CVE_2024_380083

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T20:29:06.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) dropped 21 security advisories related to Microsoft Edge and Chromium-based vulnerabilities. For convenience, I will not link all of the ones already disclosed by Google Chrome from 11 June 2024 (see parent toot above). Instead, I will list the new ones:

  • CVE-2024-30058 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38083 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

The other CVEs match those disclosed by Google on Tuesday. None of the above Microsoft Edge-specific vulnerabilities were marked as publicly disclosed or exploited. None of Google Chrome's CVEs were noted to have an exploit in the wild either.

##

CVE-2024-30103
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:45.417000

26 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

cR0w at 2024-06-12T17:37:45.404Z ##

So what happened to the update availability from the Microsoft Download Center for #CVE_2024_30103?

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-06-12T16:34:49.522Z ##

ICYMI, yesterday's #PatchTuesday had a RCE for Outlook.

This vulnerability, if exploited, can allow attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected systems, leading to potential data breaches, unauthorized access, and other malicious activities.

This Microsoft Outlook vulnerability can be circulated from user to user and doesn’t require a click to execute. Rather, execution initiates when an affected email is opened. This is notably dangerous for accounts using Microsoft Outlook’s auto-open email feature.
blog.morphisec.com/cve-2024-30103-microsoft-outlook-vulnerability

#CVE_2024_30103 #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T19:55:31.368Z ##

Morphisec: You’ve Got Mail: Critical Microsoft Outlook Vulnerability Executes as Email is Opened
Morphisec intends to release proof of concept and vulnerability details about CVE-2024-30103 (CVSSv3: 8.8 high, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability... and information on a zero-day vulnerability at DEFCON 32 (08-11 August 2024). Interestingly, Morphisec refers to CVE-2024-30103 as "a significant potential zero-day vulnerability" without providing any evidence of it being a zero-day.

#CVE_2024_30103 #vulnerability #CVE #Outlook

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T17:37:45.000Z ##

This vulnerability, if exploited, can allow attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected systems, leading to potential data breaches, unauthorized access, and other malicious activities.

This Microsoft Outlook vulnerability can be circulated from user to user and doesn’t require a click to execute. Rather, execution initiates when an affected email is opened. This is notably dangerous for accounts using Microsoft Outlook’s auto-open email feature.
blog.morphisec.com/cve-2024-30103-microsoft-outlook-vulnerability

#CVE_2024_30103 #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity

CVE-2024-30078

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30078

##

CVE-2024-31495
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:45.417000

2 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiPortal versions 7.0.0 through 7.0.6 and version 7.2.0 allows privileged user to obtain unauthorized information via the report download functionality.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.000Z ##

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd

CVE-2024-5905
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:09.010000

2 posts

A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a local low privileged Windows user to disrupt some functionality of the agent. However, they are not able to disrupt Cortex XDR agent protection mechanisms using this vulnerability.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.474Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday (er, Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks:

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent
  • CVE-2024-5906 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) Prisma Cloud Compute: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in the Web Interface
  • CVE-2024-5907 (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files
  • CVE-2024-5909 (CVSSv4: 6.8 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disable the Agent

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday (er, Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks:

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent
  • CVE-2024-5906 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) Prisma Cloud Compute: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in the Web Interface
  • CVE-2024-5907 (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files
  • CVE-2024-5909 (CVSSv4: 6.8 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disable the Agent

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

##

CVE-2024-5906
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:09.010000

2 posts

A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Prisma Cloud Compute software enables a malicious administrator with add/edit permissions for identity providers to store a JavaScript payload using the web interface on Prisma Cloud Compute. This enables a malicious administrator to perform actions in the context of another user's browser when accessed by that other user.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.474Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday (er, Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks:

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent
  • CVE-2024-5906 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) Prisma Cloud Compute: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in the Web Interface
  • CVE-2024-5907 (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files
  • CVE-2024-5909 (CVSSv4: 6.8 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disable the Agent

##

CVE-2024-5908
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:09.010000

2 posts

A problem with the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app can result in exposure of encrypted user credentials, used for connecting to GlobalProtect, in application logs. Normally, these application logs are only viewable by local users and are included when generating logs for troubleshooting purposes. This means that these encrypted credentials are exposed to recipients of the application logs.

1 repos

CVE-2024-5909
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:09.010000

2 posts

A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low privileged local Windows user to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

CVE-2024-5907
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-13T18:36:09.010000

2 posts

A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges. However, execution does require the local user to successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-13T18:35:19.777000

2 posts

Adobe Framemaker Publishing Server versions 2020.3, 2022.2 and earlier are affected by an Improper Authentication vulnerability that could result in privilege escalation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access or elevated privileges within the application. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

##

CVE-2012-1823(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 97.31%

updated 2024-06-13T06:31:59

8 posts

sapi/cgi/cgi_main.c in PHP before 5.3.12 and 5.4.x before 5.4.2, when configured as a CGI script (aka php-cgi), does not properly handle query strings that lack an = (equals sign) character, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by placing command-line options in the query string, related to lack of skipping a certain php_getopt for the 'd' case.

Nuclei template

6 repos

https://github.com/cyberharsh/PHP_CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/drone789/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/tardummy01/oscp_scripts-1

https://github.com/Unix13/metasploitable2

https://github.com/Fatalitysec/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/0xl0k1/CVE-2012-1823

dangoodin at 2024-06-07T18:17:58.748Z ##

Researchers have discovered a critical RCE in PHP for Windows. CVE-2024-4577 allows unauthenticated people to bypass the protection for a previously fixed vulnerability (CVE-2012-1823) using specific character sequences. Arbitrary code can be executed on remote PHP servers through the argument injection attack.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-06-07T11:46:16.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577 - PHP CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

This exploit uses a specific feature of Windows, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-ucoderef/d1980631-6401-428e-a49d-d71394be7da8 to inject code into a running CGI PHP.EXE on Windows, if Windows is running with Japanese, Simplified or Traditional Chinese Code Pages, bypassing a mitigation for a 2012 exploit, CVE-2012-1823

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.476Z ##

watchTowr: No Way, PHP Strikes Again! (CVE-2024-4577)
watchTowr explains CVE-2024-4577 (critical severity, disclosed 06 June 2024) which is a remote code execution vulnerability in all versions of PHP on the Windows operating system according to the vulnerability reporters. watchTowr in attempting to reproduce the vulnerability notes that it is similar to an older bug CVE-2012-1823. They were able to successfully replicate it and provide a proof of concept.

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2012_1823

CVE-2024-4577
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.20%

updated 2024-06-13T04:15:16.930000

119 posts

In PHP versions 8.1.* before 8.1.29, 8.2.* before 8.2.20, 8.3.* before 8.3.8, when using Apache and PHP-CGI on Windows, if the system is set up to use certain code pages, Windows may use "Best-Fit" behavior to replace characters in command line given to Win32 API functions. PHP CGI module may misinterpret those characters as PHP options, which may allow a malicious user to pass options to PHP bina

malware_traffic at 2024-06-12T23:47:39.152Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): I saw a single probe for CVE-2024-4577 from 221.122.67[.]75 using the "auto_prepend_file" method hit an Ubuntu Apache web server I'm currently running. I saved a sanitized example of the traffic in a #pcap available at: https://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2024/06/11/index.html

#CVE20244577
#CVE_2024_4577

This is a vulnerability against outdated versions of PHP for Windows that was publicly announced on 2024-06-06.

A quick write-up from my employer is available at: https://github.com/PaloAltoNetworks/Unit42-timely-threat-intel/blob/main/2024-06-11-CVE-2024-4577.txt

Or you could just search for the vulnerability on your own, since there's been a lot of discussion about it lately.

##
youranonriots@kolektiva.social at 2024-06-12T00:39:29.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): Our telemetry reveals ongoing exploitation attempts of #CVE20244577 in #PHP on Windows. Our customers are protected from these exploits including the "auto_append_file" method. More information we found on this vulnerability at https://bit.ly/4ekJJjx

##
ks982579@techhub.social at 2024-06-08T13:55:32.000Z ##

A new critical security flaw (CVE-2024-4577) affecting all versions of PHP on Windows has been disclosed. This CGI argument injection vulnerability allows remote code execution by bypassing protections from a previous flaw (CVE-2012-1823).

Key Points:

Impacts all PHP versions on Windows
Allows argument injection and remote code execution
Bypasses previous CVE-2012-1823 protections
Affects XAMPP installations with specific locales by default
Patches available in PHP 8.3.8, 8.2.20, and 8.1.29

Admins are urged to update PHP immediately as exploitation attempts have already been detected. Switching to more secure solutions like Mod-PHP, FastCGI, or PHP-FPM is also recommended.

This simple yet critical bug highlights the importance of thorough security reviews and timely patching.

#PHPSecurity #CVE20244577 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberSecurity #SoftwareVulnerability #WindowsOS #WebAppSecurity

HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/new-php-vulnerability-exposes-windows.html

##
habr@zhub.link at 2024-06-08T12:02:14.000Z ##

[Перевод] CVE-2024-4577: Не может быть, PHP опять под атакой

Orange Tsai недавно запостил про «Одну из уязвимостей PHP, которая влияет на XAMPP, развернутый с настройками по умолчанию», и нам было интересно рассказать немного об этом. XAMPP - очень популярный способ администраторов и разработчиков развернуть Apache, PHP и множество других инструментов, и любая ошибка, которая может быть RCE в установке этого набора по умолчанию, звучит очень заманчиво. Где нашлась очередная уязвимость PHP? Читайте далее.

https://habr.com/ru/articles/820409/

#CVE20244577 #CVE #PHP #phpcgi #xampp #rce #watchtowr #уязвимости #уязвимости_php #уязвимость

##
malware_traffic@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T23:47:39.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): I saw a single probe for CVE-2024-4577 from 221.122.67[.]75 using the "auto_prepend_file" method hit an Ubuntu Apache web server I'm currently running. I saved a sanitized example of the traffic in a #pcap available at: https://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2024/06/11/index.html

#CVE20244577
#CVE_2024_4577

This is a vulnerability against outdated versions of PHP for Windows that was publicly announced on 2024-06-06.

A quick write-up from my employer is available at: https://github.com/PaloAltoNetworks/Unit42-timely-threat-intel/blob/main/2024-06-11-CVE-2024-4577.txt

Or you could just search for the vulnerability on your own, since there's been a lot of discussion about it lately.

##
Walker@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T14:27:59.000Z ##

#CVE20244577 - this is an interesting vulnerability. I am always impressed on the novel ways attackers are exploiting frameworks.

https://x.com/Shadowserver/status/1799053497490698548

https://www.imperva.com/blog/imperva-protects-against-critical-php-vulnerability-cve-2024-4577/ #php #vulnerability

##
youranonriots@kolektiva.social at 2024-06-12T00:39:29.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): Our telemetry reveals ongoing exploitation attempts of #CVE20244577 in #PHP on Windows. Our customers are protected from these exploits including the "auto_append_file" method. More information we found on this vulnerability at https://bit.ly/4ekJJjx

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T20:37:43.967Z ##

GreyNoise: What’s Going on With CVE-2024-4577 (Critical RCE in PHP)?
GreyNoise analyzes the different payloads observed that leverage CVE-2024-4577 (see parent toots above). CISA added CVE-2024-4577 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog yesterday 12 June 2024. IOC are provided but scattered across Exhibits A-D (4 sections).

#threatintel #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #KEV #eitw #vulnerability #activeexploitation #IOC

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-4610 Arm Mali GPU Kernel Driver Use-After-Free Vulnerability and CVE-2024-4577 PHP-CGI OS Command Injection Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:32:59.347Z ##

Imperva: Update: CVE-2024-4577 quickly weaponized to distribute "TellYouThePass" Ransomware
From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

h/t: @BleepingComputer reporting: TellYouThePass ransomware exploits recent PHP RCE flaw to breach servers

#threatintel #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #ransomware #TellYouThePass #IOC

##
kpwn at 2024-06-10T19:35:22.403Z ##

SCNR

https://infosec.exchange/@ibboard@hachyderm.io/112585613637222411

#Pentesting #AppSec #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #BugBounty #Hacking #CVE #CVE_2024_4577 #Memes

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T00:10:19.224Z ##

SANS ISC: Attacker Probing for New PHP Vulnerablity CVE-2024-4577
More honeypot exploitation attempts for the PHP RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-4577: @jullrich of SANS Technology Institute Internet Storm Center (ISC) reports that 79.124.49.158 which has been active in their logs since March 2024 and previously attempted other PHP-related exploits, was caught using an exploit matching watchTowr's Proof of Concept (see parent toot above). Note: Johannes misspelled watchTowr.

VirusTotal check of IP address: "4/93 security vendors flagged this IP address as malicious" and "according to source CrowdSec: Behaviors: HTTP DoS / HTTP Exploit / HTTP Scan"

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel #honeypot

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-08T16:57:54.341Z ##

Orange Sauce, a self-described "Student/Information security enthusiast" reports CVE-2024-4577 exploitation in the wild (note: against a honeypot) on Twitter. The linked VirusTotal check is allegedly a Gh0stRAT payload. Chinese cybersecurity company QuanXIN also reports active exploitation. cc: @todb @wdormann

IOC:

  • 138[.]201[.]126[.]53
  • hxxp://154[.]201[.]91[.]59:44557/system64.exe
  • a4b25c7a464cabbedef80a704ec8c7cd84a98073b055ddc42f2fb5b7d81ff250

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.000Z ##

watchTowr: No Way, PHP Strikes Again! (CVE-2024-4577)
watchTowr explains CVE-2024-4577 (critical severity, disclosed 06 June 2024) which is a remote code execution vulnerability in all versions of PHP on the Windows operating system according to the vulnerability reporters. watchTowr in attempting to reproduce the vulnerability notes that it is similar to an older bug CVE-2012-1823. They were able to successfully replicate it and provide a proof of concept.

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2012_1823

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T20:37:43.967Z ##

From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

#CVE_2024_4577

This is a vulnerability against outdated versions of PHP for Windows that was publicly announced on 2024-06-06.

A quick write-up from my employer is available at: https://github.com/PaloAltoNetworks/Unit42-timely-threat-intel/blob/main/2024-06-11-CVE-2024-4577.txt

Or you could just search for the vulnerability on your own, since there's been a lot of discussion about it lately.

##
Walker at 2024-06-12T14:27:59.396Z ##

#CVE20244577 - this is an interesting vulnerability. I am always impressed on the novel ways attackers are exploiting frameworks.

https://x.com/Shadowserver/status/1799053497490698548

https://www.imperva.com/blog/imperva-protects-against-critical-php-vulnerability-cve-2024-4577/ #php #vulnerability

##
youranonriots@kolektiva.social at 2024-06-12T00:39:29.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): Our telemetry reveals ongoing exploitation attempts of #CVE20244577 in #PHP on Windows. Our customers are protected from these exploits including the "auto_append_file" method. More information we found on this vulnerability at https://bit.ly/4ekJJjx

##
ks982579@techhub.social at 2024-06-08T13:55:32.000Z ##

A new critical security flaw (CVE-2024-4577) affecting all versions of PHP on Windows has been disclosed. This CGI argument injection vulnerability allows remote code execution by bypassing protections from a previous flaw (CVE-2012-1823).

Key Points:

Impacts all PHP versions on Windows
Allows argument injection and remote code execution
Bypasses previous CVE-2012-1823 protections
Affects XAMPP installations with specific locales by default
Patches available in PHP 8.3.8, 8.2.20, and 8.1.29

Admins are urged to update PHP immediately as exploitation attempts have already been detected. Switching to more secure solutions like Mod-PHP, FastCGI, or PHP-FPM is also recommended.

This simple yet critical bug highlights the importance of thorough security reviews and timely patching.

#PHPSecurity #CVE20244577 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberSecurity #SoftwareVulnerability #WindowsOS #WebAppSecurity

HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/new-php-vulnerability-exposes-windows.html

##
habr@zhub.link at 2024-06-08T12:02:14.000Z ##

[Перевод] CVE-2024-4577: Не может быть, PHP опять под атакой

Orange Tsai недавно запостил про «Одну из уязвимостей PHP, которая влияет на XAMPP, развернутый с настройками по умолчанию», и нам было интересно рассказать немного об этом. XAMPP - очень популярный способ администраторов и разработчиков развернуть Apache, PHP и множество других инструментов, и любая ошибка, которая может быть RCE в установке этого набора по умолчанию, звучит очень заманчиво. Где нашлась очередная уязвимость PHP? Читайте далее.

https://habr.com/ru/articles/820409/

#CVE20244577 #CVE #PHP #phpcgi #xampp #rce #watchtowr #уязвимости #уязвимости_php #уязвимость

malware_traffic@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T23:47:39.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): I saw a single probe for CVE-2024-4577 from 221.122.67[.]75 using the "auto_prepend_file" method hit an Ubuntu Apache web server I'm currently running. ##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T21:41:25.674Z ##

@da_667 I'm trying to determine if CVE-2024-4577 is actually getting exploited in the wild as opposed to just honeypotting.

  • 07 June 2024, honeypot: https://twitter.com/burp_heart/status/1799455219543404633
  • 07 June 2024, unknown: https://twitter.com/Xlab_qax/status/1799418841149436318
  • 09 June 2024, honeypot: https://isc.sans.edu/diary/rss/30994
  • 09 June 2024, confirmed by @ibboard as an actual exploit attempt: https://hachyderm.io/@ibboard/112596520277998664
  • 10 June 2024, actual exploitation, and used in a ransomware attack: https://www.imperva.com/blog/update-cve-2024-4577-quickly-weaponized-to-distribute-tellyouthepass-ransomware/

There is a good chance that this will be added to the CISA KEV Catalog based on the evidence.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:33:28.285Z ##

@ibboard Dunno if you already seen it but the proof of concept for CVE-2024-4577 is out and uses that partial string: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

Just for context, is the script kiddy attempting to exploit your actual server or a honeypot?

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T22:49:49.507Z ##

@derickr Devcore only mentions traditional Chinese simplified Chinese, and Japanese locales as having been verified. Do you see other locales as potentially vulnerable?
There's also honey exploitation attempts observed so far. Do you think there might be mass exploitation now that a Proof of Concept is available for CVE-2024-4577?

##
derickr@phpc.social at 2024-06-10T14:43:36.000Z ##

@sean @ramsey In short:

CVE-2024-4577 enables remote attackers to execute arbitrary code if the Windows system locale is set to Chinese/Japanese locales and CGI is running under Apache.

The issue arises when Apache passes a request URI without a question mark to PHP-CGI.
In Chinese/Japanese system locales, Windows transforms certain non-ASCII characters to ASCII using a "best fit" mapping.

Command line filtering code failed to account for this behaviour, allowing attackers to bypass checks.

##
sans_isc at 2024-06-09T21:05:25.740Z ##

The bug was initially discovered by DEVCORE: https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
chipswithfries@mastodon.social at 2024-06-09T09:14:24.000Z ##

@ibboard that's not a mistake, that's a vulnerability in PHP on Windows where shy hyphens are substituted for real hyphens, allowing php.exe to be called with arbitrary options.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
josephzeng at 2024-06-08T03:01:24.663Z ##

[CVE-2024-4577] The Best-Fit feature in Windows encoding conversion allows attackers to bypass protections by interpreting soft hyphens (0xAD) as real hyphens (0x2D), enabling code execution.

POC:
https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-4577
https://github.com/11whoami99/CVE-2024-4577

Write-ups: https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/
https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#php #vulnerability

##
shaknais@mastodon.social at 2024-06-07T22:05:26.000Z ##

Just in time for the weekend!

CVE-2024-4577: Proof of Concept Available for PHP-CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://buaq.net/go-244036.html

#PHP #Vulnerability #Critical

##
kpwn at 2024-06-07T20:45:25.768Z ##

🚨 Windows-based #PHP is vulnerable to #RCE when used in #CGI mode 🚨

The soft hyphen character (­­­­0xAD) is not escaped by the CGI handler. PHP applies it's best fit mapping and turns it into a real hyphen (0x2D).

This allows additional command line arguments to be passed to php.exe, ultimately leading to RCE.

Full details here: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#Pentesting #AppSec #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #BugBounty #Hacking

##
rickoooooo@social.authbypass.com at 2024-06-07T18:44:24.000Z ##

screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T18:35:11.942Z ##

##
dangoodin at 2024-06-07T18:17:58.748Z ##

Researchers have discovered a critical RCE in PHP for Windows. CVE-2024-4577 allows unauthenticated people to bypass the protection for a previously fixed vulnerability (CVE-2012-1823) using specific character sequences. Arbitrary code can be executed on remote PHP servers through the argument injection attack.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-06-07T11:46:16.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577 - PHP CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

This exploit uses a specific feature of Windows, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-ucoderef/d1980631-6401-428e-a49d-d71394be7da8 to inject code into a running CGI PHP.EXE on Windows, if Windows is running with Japanese, Simplified or Traditional Chinese Code Pages, bypassing a mitigation for a 2012 exploit, CVE-2012-1823

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T11:29:43.476Z ##

watchTowr: No Way, PHP Strikes Again! (CVE-2024-4577)
watchTowr explains CVE-2024-4577 (critical severity, disclosed 06 June 2024) which is a remote code execution vulnerability in all versions of PHP on the Windows operating system according to the vulnerability reporters. watchTowr in attempting to reproduce the vulnerability notes that it is similar to an older bug CVE-2012-1823. They were able to successfully replicate it and provide a proof of concept.

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2012_1823

##
derickr@phpc.social at 2024-06-10T14:43:36.000Z ##

@sean @ramsey In short:

CVE-2024-4577 enables remote attackers to execute arbitrary code if the Windows system locale is set to Chinese/Japanese locales and CGI is running under Apache.

The issue arises when Apache passes a request URI without a question mark to PHP-CGI.
In Chinese/Japanese system locales, Windows transforms certain non-ASCII characters to ASCII using a "best fit" mapping.

Command line filtering code failed to account for this behaviour, allowing attackers to bypass checks.

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-09T12:42:07.000Z ##

Security firm watchTowr has published its own analysis of CVE-2024-4577, a PHP-CGI vulnerability impacting Windows systems: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

The bug was initially discovered by DEVCORE: https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

watchTowr has also released proof-of-concept code: https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/CVE-2024-4577 #infosec #cybersecurity #security

@wdormann I agree that honeypot exploitation attempts are not the same as actual attacks. But it is a canary in the coal mine, perhaps a precursor to targeted exploitation. CVE-2024-4577 is not a Metasploit module yet, so a real human bean likely pulled the trigger on this.

##
josephzeng@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-08T03:01:24.000Z ##

[CVE-2024-4577] The Best-Fit feature in Windows encoding conversion allows attackers to bypass protections by interpreting soft hyphens (0xAD) as real hyphens (0x2D), enabling code execution.

POC:
https://github.com/TAM-K592/CVE-2024-4577
https://github.com/11whoami99/CVE-2024-4577

Write-ups: https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/
https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#php #vulnerability

##
shaknais@mastodon.social at 2024-06-07T22:05:26.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577: Proof of Concept Available for PHP-CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

#PHP #Vulnerability #Critical

##
kpwn@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T20:45:25.000Z ##

🚨 Windows-based #PHP is vulnerable to #RCE when used in #CGI mode 🚨

The soft hyphen character (­­­­0xAD) is not escaped by the CGI handler. PHP applies it's best fit mapping and turns it into a real hyphen (0x2D).

This allows additional command line arguments to be passed to php.exe, ultimately leading to RCE.

Full details here: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

#Pentesting #AppSec #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #BugBounty #Hacking

##
rickoooooo@social.authbypass.com at 2024-06-07T18:44:24.000Z ##

##
dangoodin@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T18:17:58.000Z ##

Researchers have discovered a critical RCE in PHP for Windows. CVE-2024-4577 allows unauthenticated people to bypass the protection for a previously fixed vulnerability (CVE-2012-1823) using specific character sequences. Arbitrary code can be executed on remote PHP servers through the argument injection attack.

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

##
isotopp@chaos.social at 2024-06-07T11:46:16.000Z ##

CVE-2024-4577 - PHP CGI Argument Injection Vulnerability

https://devco.re/blog/2024/06/06/security-alert-cve-2024-4577-php-cgi-argument-injection-vulnerability-en/

This exploit uses a specific feature of Windows, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-ucoderef/d1980631-6401-428e-a49d-d71394be7da8 to inject code into a running CGI PHP.EXE on Windows, if Windows is running with Japanese, Simplified or Traditional Chinese Code Pages, bypassing a mitigation for a 2012 exploit, CVE-2012-1823

CVE-2024-4610
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 21.26%

updated 2024-06-13T01:00:02.087000

17 posts

Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T14:55:09.029Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-4610 Arm Mali GPU Kernel Driver Use-After-Free Vulnerability and CVE-2024-4577 PHP-CGI OS Command Injection Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilities #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_4610 #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #Mali #CISA

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.603Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##
avoidthehack at 2024-06-11T15:36:01.126Z ##

Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali #GPU kernel #drivers

Tracked as CVE-2024-4610, exploited in the wild.

Affects “all versions” of Bifrost and Valhall drivers from r34p0 through r40p0.

This was originally fixed by ARM in NOV 2022, but due to #Android supply chain complexities (in this case, the device manufacturers need to integrate the fix into the device’s firmware), users may not have the most updated drivers…

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/arm-warns-of-actively-exploited-flaw-in-mali-gpu-kernel-drivers

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-06-11T07:33:26.128Z ##

Active Exploitation of Mali GPU Kernel Driver Flaw

Date: June 10, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-4610
Vulnerability Type: [[Use-After-Free]] (UAF)
CWE: [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-119]]
Sources: Bleeping Computer, The Register, HotHardware

Synopsis

Arm has issued a security bulletin concerning a critical memory-related vulnerability in its Mali GPU kernel drivers, which is currently being exploited in the wild. This vulnerability affects Bifrost and Valhall GPU kernel drivers across multiple versions.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as [[CVE-2024-4610]], is a [[use-after-free]] flaw in the Mali GPU kernel drivers. This flaw allows a local non-privileged user to perform improper GPU memory operations, gaining access to already freed memory. The flaw impacts all versions of the Bifrost and Valhall drivers from r34p0 through r40p0.

Technical Key Findings

Use-after-free vulnerabilities occur when a program continues to use a pointer to a memory location after it has been freed. This can lead to serious issues such as information disclosure and arbitrary code execution. In the case of CVE-2024-4610, a local attacker could exploit this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the affected system, potentially leading to a full system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • Bifrost GPUs: Versions r34p0 to r40p0
  • Valhall GPUs: Versions r34p0 to r40p0
  • Devices: Including but not limited to Samsung Galaxy S20, Xiaomi Redmi K30, Motorola Edge 40, OnePlus Nord 2, Chromebooks, and various embedded systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to severe consequences, including unauthorized access to sensitive information, system compromise, and potential deployment of malware. The vulnerability's exploitation in the wild indicates a significant risk, especially for high-value targets such as activists and journalists.

Patches or Workaround

Arm has released a patch for this vulnerability in version r41p0 of the Bifrost and Valhall GPU Kernel Driver, available since November 24, 2022. Users are advised to update their drivers to the latest version to mitigate this risk. Due to the complexity of the supply chain, some users may experience delays in receiving the updates.

Tags

#CVE-2024-4610 #MaliGPU #Arm #UseAfterFree #Vulnerability #Patch #CyberSecurity #AndroidDevices #SystemCompromise #HighRisk

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T16:18:33.000Z ##

- CVE-2024-4610: #Arm Mali GPU Kernel Driver Use-After-Free Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4610

- CVE-2024-4577: #PHP-CGI OS Command Injection Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4577

Advisory:

Phone Scammers Impersonating CISA Employees https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/06/12/phone-scammers-impersonating-cisa-employees @cisacyber

Date: June 10, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-4610
Vulnerability Type: [[Use-After-Free]] (UAF)
CWE: [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-119]]
Sources: Bleeping Computer, The Register, HotHardware

Synopsis

Arm has issued a security bulletin concerning a critical memory-related vulnerability in its Mali GPU kernel drivers, which is currently being exploited in the wild. This vulnerability affects Bifrost and Valhall GPU kernel drivers across multiple versions.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as [[CVE-2024-4610]], is a [[use-after-free]] flaw in the Mali GPU kernel drivers. This flaw allows a local non-privileged user to perform improper GPU memory operations, gaining access to already freed memory. The flaw impacts all versions of the Bifrost and Valhall drivers from r34p0 through r40p0.

Technical Key Findings

Use-after-free vulnerabilities occur when a program continues to use a pointer to a memory location after it has been freed. This can lead to serious issues such as information disclosure and arbitrary code execution. In the case of CVE-2024-4610, a local attacker could exploit this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the affected system, potentially leading to a full system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • Bifrost GPUs: Versions r34p0 to r40p0
  • Valhall GPUs: Versions r34p0 to r40p0
  • Devices: Including but not limited to Samsung Galaxy S20, Xiaomi Redmi K30, Motorola Edge 40, OnePlus Nord 2, Chromebooks, and various embedded systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to severe consequences, including unauthorized access to sensitive information, system compromise, and potential deployment of malware. The vulnerability's exploitation in the wild indicates a significant risk, especially for high-value targets such as activists and journalists.

Patches or Workaround

Arm has released a patch for this vulnerability in version r41p0 of the Bifrost and Valhall GPU Kernel Driver, available since November 24, 2022. Users are advised to update their drivers to the latest version to mitigate this risk. Due to the complexity of the supply chain, some users may experience delays in receiving the updates.

No mention of exploitation.

##

CVE-2024-1228
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-06-12T18:31:43

2 posts

Use of hard-coded password to the patients' database allows an attacker to retrieve sensitive data stored in the database. The password is the same among all Eurosoft Przychodnia installations. This issue affects Eurosoft Przychodnia software before version 20240417.001 (from that version vulnerability is fixed).

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T14:32:45.536Z ##

CERT.PL (Poland): Vulnerabilities in medical clinics software
CERT.PL of Poland mentions 3 vulnerabilities in Eurosoft Przychodnia, drEryk Gabinet and Simple Care (medical software) which use hardcoded credentials. CVE-2024-1228, CVE-2024-3699 and CVE-2024-3700 all have CVSSv4 scores of 9.3 critical severity. While the first two have patches, Simple Care is noted to be no longer supported.

#vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_1228 #CVE_2024_3699 #CVE_2024_3700

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T14:32:45.000Z ##

CERT.PL (Poland): Vulnerabilities in medical clinics software
CERT.PL of Poland mentions 3 vulnerabilities in Eurosoft Przychodnia, drEryk Gabinet and Simple Care (medical software) which use hardcoded credentials. CVE-2024-1228, CVE-2024-3699 and CVE-2024-3700 all have CVSSv4 scores of 9.3 critical severity. While the first two have patches, Simple Care is noted to be no longer supported.

##

CVE-2024-3700
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-12T18:31:43

2 posts

Use of hard-coded password to the patients' database allows an attacker to retrieve sensitive data stored in the database. The password is the same among all Simple Care software installations. This issue affects Estomed Sp. z o.o. Simple Care software in all versions. The software is no longer supported.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T14:32:45.536Z ##

CERT.PL (Poland): Vulnerabilities in medical clinics software
CERT.PL of Poland mentions 3 vulnerabilities in Eurosoft Przychodnia, drEryk Gabinet and Simple Care (medical software) which use hardcoded credentials. CVE-2024-1228, CVE-2024-3699 and CVE-2024-3700 all have CVSSv4 scores of 9.3 critical severity. While the first two have patches, Simple Care is noted to be no longer supported.

#vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_1228 #CVE_2024_3699 #CVE_2024_3700

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T14:32:45.000Z ##

CERT.PL (Poland): Vulnerabilities in medical clinics software
CERT.PL of Poland mentions 3 vulnerabilities in Eurosoft Przychodnia, drEryk Gabinet and Simple Care (medical software) which use hardcoded credentials. CVE-2024-1228, CVE-2024-3699 and CVE-2024-3700 all have CVSSv4 scores of 9.3 critical severity. While the first two have patches, Simple Care is noted to be no longer supported.

(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-12T17:49:04.017000

7 posts

GitHub access token could be exposed to third-party sites in JetBrains IDEs after version 2023.1 and less than: IntelliJ IDEA 2023.1.7, 2023.2.7, 2023.3.7, 2024.1.3, 2024.2 EAP3; Aqua 2024.1.2; CLion 2023.1.7, 2023.2.4, 2023.3.5, 2024.1.3, 2024.2 EAP2; DataGrip 2023.1.3, 2023.2.4, 2023.3.5, 2024.1.4; DataSpell 2023.1.6, 2023.2.7, 2023.3.6, 2024.1.2, 2024.2 EAP1; GoLand 2023.1.6, 2023.2.7, 2023.3.7

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T19:05:26.918Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: Updates for security issue affecting IntelliJ-based IDEs 2023.1+ and JetBrains GitHub Plugin
A new security issue was discovered that affects the JetBrains GitHub plugin on the IntelliJ Platform, which could lead to disclosure of access tokens to third-party sites. CVE-2024-37051 (CVSSv3: 9.3 CRITICAL) GitHub access token could be exposed to third-party sites in JetBrains IDEs. No mention of exploitation.

h/t: @serghei See related Bleeping Computer reporting: JetBrains warns of IntelliJ IDE bug exposing GitHub access tokens

#CVE_2024_37051 #JetBrains #IntelliJ #GitHub

3 posts

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-12T15:45:03.000Z ##

Critical Flaw In Apple Ecosystems Let Attackers Gain Unauthorized Access https://gbhackers.com/critical-flaw-apple-ecosystems/ #ProofofConceptAttack #CVE/vulnerability #CyberSecurityNews #DataExfiltration #Applesecurity #CVE202427801 #Apple

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T19:56:41.542Z ##

wangtielei: PoC for CVE-2024-27801 (Universal UAF in NSXPC on all Apple platforms)
CVE-2024-27801 (CVSS score pending, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Apple) Elevation of Privilege vulnerability in Foundation (of iOS, tvOS, visionOS, iPadOS, watchOS, and macOS Sonoma). Wangtielei describes it as a Use After Free "in the low level implementation of NSXPC that has been present since the initial release of NSXPC (over decade ago)."

This vulnerability could have potentially allowed malicious apps to gain unauthorized access to system services or steal user data from certain third-party applications, particularly those with architectures similar to Telegram. Our proof-of-concept attack demonstrated how a malicious app could steal chat history (such as pictures) from Telegram and transfer it to a remote server.

#CVE_2024_27801 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T19:56:41.000Z ##

wangtielei: PoC for CVE-2024-27801 (Universal UAF in NSXPC on all Apple platforms)
CVE-2024-27801 (CVSS score pending, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Apple) Elevation of Privilege vulnerability in Foundation (of iOS, tvOS, visionOS, iPadOS, watchOS, and macOS Sonoma). Wangtielei describes it as a Use After Free "in the low level implementation of NSXPC that has been present since the initial release of NSXPC (over decade ago)."

This vulnerability could have potentially allowed malicious apps to gain unauthorized access to system services or steal user data from certain third-party applications, particularly those with architectures similar to Telegram. Our proof-of-concept attack demonstrated how a malicious app could steal chat history (such as pictures) from Telegram and transfer it to a remote server.

#CVE_2024_27801 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2024-21754
(1.8 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:27

8 posts

A use of password hash with insufficient computational effort vulnerability [CWE-916] affecting FortiOS version 7.4.3 and below, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions and FortiProxy version 7.4.2 and below, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 2.0 all versions may allow a privileged attacker with super-admin profile and CLI access to decrypting the backup file.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.870Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:49:02.000Z ##

German security firm G Data has discovered that Fortinet firewalls use weak password hashes to secure backup files.

https://www.gdatasoftware.com/blog/2024/01/37834-passwords-on-a-silver-platter

Tracked as CVE-2024-21754, the vulnerability can be exploited to decrypt backup files and read a device's login credentials.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-423

"Those backup files are commonly sent back and forth via email, for review and control purposes."

#infosec #cybersecurity #security

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

##

CVE-2024-23110
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:26

4 posts

A stack-based buffer overflow in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.4.0 through 7.4.2, 7.2.0 through 7.2.6, 7.0.0 through 7.0.13, 6.4.0 through 6.4.14, 6.2.0 through 6.2.15, 6.0 all versions allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted commands

jbhall56 at 2024-06-13T12:45:08.711Z ##

The most severe of the issues is CVE-2024-23110 (CVSS score of 7.4), which collectively tracks multiple stack-based buffer overflow security defects in the platform’s command line interpreter. https://www.securityweek.com/fortinet-patches-code-execution-vulnerability-in-fortios/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd

  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)

##

CVE-2024-23282(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T09:32:46

4 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5, watchOS 10.5, iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, iOS 16.7.8 and iPadOS 16.7.8. A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T12:36:08.238Z ##

One of the disclosed Apple vulnerabilities in macOS Sonoma 14.5 from yesterday 10 June 2024 has the wildest impact:

CVE-2024-23282: A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization

Reminds me of this Twitter gem (see attached image)

Also the vulnerability submitter said this:

This bug can leak user data on iOS even when Lockdown Mode is enabled! While Lockdown Mode blocks incoming FaceTime calls, it cannot block outgoing FaceTime calls.

This is very easy to exploit and is reliable.

#CVE_2024_23282 #Apple #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T12:36:08.000Z ##

One of the disclosed Apple vulnerabilities in macOS Sonoma 14.5 from yesterday 10 June 2024 has the wildest impact:

CVE-2024-23282: A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization

Reminds me of this Twitter gem (see attached image)

Also the vulnerability submitter said this:

This bug can leak user data on iOS even when Lockdown Mode is enabled! While Lockdown Mode blocks incoming FaceTime calls, it cannot block outgoing FaceTime calls.

This is very easy to exploit and is reliable.

#CVE_2024_23282 #Apple #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-29855
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T06:31:53

4 posts

Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

1 repos

https://github.com/sinsinology/CVE-2024-29855

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:07:48.770Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Veeam Recovery Orchestrator Vulnerability (CVE-2024-29855)
CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Veeam) Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

Note: The attacker must know the exact username and role of an account that has an active VRO UI access token to accomplish the hijack.

Affects version 7.0.0.337. Resolved in versions 7.1.0.230 and 7.0.0.379. No mention of exploitation.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T13:07:48.000Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Veeam Recovery Orchestrator Vulnerability (CVE-2024-29855)
CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Veeam) Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

Note: The attacker must know the exact username and role of an account that has an active VRO UI access token to accomplish the hijack.

Affects version 7.0.0.337. Resolved in versions 7.1.0.230 and 7.0.0.379. No mention of exploitation.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE

##

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:59

1 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

7 repos

https://github.com/mattaperkins/FIX-CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/exfil0/test_iconv

https://github.com/tnishiox/cve-2024-2961

https://github.com/ambionics/cnext-exploits

https://github.com/rvizx/CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/kjdfklha/CVE-2024-2961_poc

https://github.com/absolutedesignltd/iconvfix

ringzer0@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T00:00:01.000Z ##

CVE-2024-5499(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:06

1 posts

Out of bounds write in Streams API in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.141 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-03T22:06:38.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5493 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5493 Heap buffer overflow in WebRTC
  • CVE-2024-5494 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5494 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-5495 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5495 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-5496 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5496 Use after free in Media Session
  • CVE-2024-5497 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5497 Out of bounds memory access in Keyboard Inputs
  • CVE-2024-5498 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5498 Use after free in Presentation API
  • CVE-2024-5499 (high) Chromium: CVE-2024-5499 Out of bounds write in Streams API

These CVEs were assigned by Chrome. Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation. These CVEs were disclosed Thursday 30 May 2024 by Google (see parent toot above). Today's updates were minimally documented in Release notes for Microsoft Edge Security Updates

#PatchTuesday #Edge #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #CVE

CVE-2024-4603(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:03

2 posts

Issue summary: Checking excessively long DSA keys or parameters may be very slow. Impact summary: Applications that use the functions EVP_PKEY_param_check() or EVP_PKEY_public_check() to check a DSA public key or DSA parameters may experience long delays. Where the key or parameters that are being checked have been obtained from an untrusted source this may lead to a Denial of Service. The funct

harrysintonen at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.289Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.000Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

CVE-2024-27822(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-10T18:30:59

CVE-2024-27322
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-10T18:30:57

3 posts

Deserialization of untrusted data can occur in the R statistical programming language, on any version starting at 1.4.0 up to and not including 4.4.0, enabling a maliciously crafted RDS (R Data Serialization) formatted file or R package to run arbitrary code on an end user’s system when interacted with.

##

CVE-2023-50868(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:30:52

4 posts

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations

1 repos

https://github.com/Goethe-Universitat-Cybersecurity/NSEC3-Encloser-Attack

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.609Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:13:37.255Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 51 vulnerabilities, one is publicly disclosed:
MITRE: CVE-2023-50868 (7.5 high) NSEC3 closest encloser proof can exhaust CPU. CVE-2023-50868 is regarding a vulnerability in DNSSEC validation where an attacker could exploit standard DNSSEC protocols intended for DNS integrity by using excessive resources on a resolver, causing a denial of service for legitimate users. MITRE created this CVE on their behalf.

If you consider a publicly disclosed vulnerability a zero-day, that's the takeaway for Microsoft releases. No mention of exploitation for everything else. Checked against the actual MSRC Security Update Guide: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability

cc: @regnil @cR0w @bschwifty @arinc629 @Cali @wvu @hrbrmstr @avoidthehack @bieberium (make sure to remove all the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#PatchTuesday #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2023_50868

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-50387
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.00%

updated 2024-06-10T17:16:15.963000

2 posts

Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4033, 4034, 4035, 6840, and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. One of the concerns is that, when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIG records, the protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluate all combinations of DNSKE

2 repos

https://github.com/Meirelez/SSR-DNSSEC

https://github.com/knqyf263/CVE-2023-50387

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.609Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

CVE-2024-23692
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-06-07T17:15:50.027000

4 posts

Rejetto HTTP File Server, up to and including version 2.3m, is vulnerable to a template injection vulnerability. This vulnerability allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system by sending a specially crafted HTTP request. As of the CVE assignment date, Rejetto HFS 2.3m is no longer supported.

Nuclei template

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.97%

updated 2024-06-07T13:25:37.403000

6 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

1 repos

#search_error

CISA confirms CVE-2024-1086 active attacks in the wild on Linux kernel versions 5.14-6.6.14 using netfilter vuln for privilege escalation. Major distros like Debian, Fedora, RHEL, Ubuntu affected. Check if you're patched with "uname -r".

Mitigation steps in article. Stay safe!

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-03T18:05:01.000Z ##

CISA warns of actively exploited #Linux privilege elevation flaw

Tracked as CVE-2024-1086 and confirmed exploitation in the wild. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker local access to gain privilege escalation - which could in turn result in root-level access.

Originally disclosed in JAN 2024.

This has been fixed in multiple stable kernel versions.

#cybersecurity #security #cve #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-linux-privilege-elevation-flaw/

CVE-2024-5480
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-06T21:30:46

5 posts

A vulnerability in the PyTorch's torch.distributed.rpc framework, specifically in versions prior to 2.2.2, allows for remote code execution (RCE). The framework, which is used in distributed training scenarios, does not properly verify the functions being called during RPC (Remote Procedure Call) operations. This oversight permits attackers to execute arbitrary commands by leveraging built-in Pyth

mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-06-11T20:47:28.792Z ##

RCE in #PyTorch (CVE-2024-5480):

When using torch.distributed.rpc for multi-cpu RPC communication, worker can use functions like rpc.rpc_sync to serialize and package the functions and tensors into a PythonUDF, then sent it using a PythonCall (inherited from RpcCommandBase).
huntr.com/bounties/39811836-c5b3-4999-831e-46fee8fcade3

#CVE_2024_5480

CVE-2024-28995
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-06T09:30:52

15 posts

SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

5 repos
