jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-14T11:05:02.000Z ##

SolarWinds Serv-U Vulnerability Let Attackers Access sensitive files https://gbhackers.com/solarwinds-serv-u-vulnerability-access-sensitive-files/ #VulnerabilityRemediation #directorytraversal #CVE/vulnerability #CyberSecurityNews #IncidentResponse #NetworkSecurity #SolarWindsServU #CVE202428995

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:36:54.081Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-28995: Trivially Exploitable Information Disclosure Vulnerability in SolarWinds Serv-U
See parent toot above for more information on CVE-2024-28995. Rapid7's vulnerability research team has reproduced the vulnerability and confirmed that it's trivially exploitable and allows an external unauthenticated attacker to read any file on disk, including binary files, so long as they know the path and the file is not locked (i.e., opened exclusively by something else). Rapid7 expects CVE-2024-28995 to be exploited in the wild soon.

cc: @reverseics @cR0w

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T16:24:23.158Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory: SolarWinds Serv-U Directory Transversal Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28995)
CVE-2024-28995 (8.6 high) SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability (cc: @reverseics) that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

#CVE_2024_28995 #SolarWinds #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T18:47:02.234Z ##

CVE-2024-20405
(4.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-05T18:30:35

2 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input for specific HTTP requests that are sent to an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to cl

1 repos

https://github.com/AbdElRahmanEzzat1995/CVE-2024-20405

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.335Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_29404 #CVE_2024_29405

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.000Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

CVE-2024-36121
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-05T16:53:49

1 posts

### Summary BoringSSLAEADContext keeps track of how many OHTTP responses have been sent and uses this sequence number to calculate the appropriate nonce to use with the encryption algorithm. Unfortunately, two separate errors combine which would allow an attacker to cause the sequence number to overflow and thus the nonce to repeat. ### Details 1. There is no overflow detection or enforcement of

SalusaSecondus@wandering.shop at 2024-06-04T22:19:58.000Z ##

To all those security people out there thinking that you can't be a "real" security engineer without a #CVE (and preferably lots of them). I want to share the *first* CVE that I actually have in almost 20 years of work!

Why so long? Almost nothing I fixed was publicly visible or semi-coordinated embargoes made a CVE impractical.

Don't let people gatekeep you with stupid stuff.

CVE-2024-36121

(No, it isn't practically exploitable. Nothing to worry about.)
https://github.com/netty/netty-incubator-codec-ohttp/security/advisories/GHSA-g762-h86w-8749

CVE-2024-29974
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-05T06:15:10.657000

3 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** The remote code execution vulnerability in the CGI program “file_upload-cgi” in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code by uploading a crafted configuration file to a vulnerable device.

1 repos

#search_error

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-06T12:40:04.000Z ##

Zyxel patches critical flaws in EOL NAS devices https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/06/06/cve-2024-29972-cve-2024-29973-cve-2024-29974/ #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Outpost24 #Hotstuff #patch #Zyxel #News #CVE #NAS #PoC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T18:51:44.000Z ##

Outpost24: Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
Outpost24 provided vulnerability details and proofs of concept for five Zyxel NAS vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-29972 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29973 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29974 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29975 (6.7 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29976 (6.5 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability

Zyxel has treated the disclosure process fairly, agreeing to a coordinated disclosure. Despite the fact that the device has reached End-of-Life by the end of last year, they still released patches for the three critical vulnerabilities CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974. Furthermore, as the device has reached End-of-Life, they decided to remove the "Remote Support" account "NsaRescueAngel".

h/t: @BleepingComputer Zyxel issues emergency RCE patch for end-of-life NAS devices

#CVE #Zyxel #vulnerability #proofofconcept

##

#Zyxel issues emergency RCE patch for end-of-life NAS devices for CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974 https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/zyxel-issues-emergency-rce-patch-for-end-of-life-nas-devices/ @BleepingComputer

This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability was introduced in version 5.2 of Confluence Data Center and Server. This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 8.3, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to availability, and requires no user interaction.  Atla

SolarWinds security advisories (disclosed 04 June 2024):

  • CVE-2024-29004 (7.1 high) SolarWinds Platform Stored XSS Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28999 (6.4 medium) SolarWinds Platform Race Condition Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28996 (7.5 high) SolarWinds Platform SWQL Injection Vulnerability

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-29972
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

3 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** The command injection vulnerability in the CGI program "remote_help-cgi" in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute some operating system (OS) commands by sending a crafted HTTP POST request.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-06T12:40:04.000Z ##

Zyxel patches critical flaws in EOL NAS devices https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/06/06/cve-2024-29972-cve-2024-29973-cve-2024-29974/ #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Outpost24 #Hotstuff #patch #Zyxel #News #CVE #NAS #PoC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T18:51:44.000Z ##

Outpost24: Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
Outpost24 provided vulnerability details and proofs of concept for five Zyxel NAS vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-29972 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29973 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29974 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29975 (6.7 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29976 (6.5 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability

Zyxel has treated the disclosure process fairly, agreeing to a coordinated disclosure. Despite the fact that the device has reached End-of-Life by the end of last year, they still released patches for the three critical vulnerabilities CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974. Furthermore, as the device has reached End-of-Life, they decided to remove the "Remote Support" account "NsaRescueAngel".

h/t: @BleepingComputer Zyxel issues emergency RCE patch for end-of-life NAS devices

#CVE #Zyxel #vulnerability #proofofconcept

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

Outpost24: Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
Outpost24 provided vulnerability details and proofs of concept for five Zyxel NAS vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-29972 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29973 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29974 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29975 (6.7 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29976 (6.5 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability

Zyxel has treated the disclosure process fairly, agreeing to a coordinated disclosure. Despite the fact that the device has reached End-of-Life by the end of last year, they still released patches for the three critical vulnerabilities CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974. Furthermore, as the device has reached End-of-Life, they decided to remove the "Remote Support" account "NsaRescueAngel".

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

1 posts

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T18:51:44.000Z ##

Outpost24: Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
Outpost24 provided vulnerability details and proofs of concept for five Zyxel NAS vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-29972 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29973 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29974 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29975 (6.7 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29976 (6.5 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability

Zyxel has treated the disclosure process fairly, agreeing to a coordinated disclosure. Despite the fact that the device has reached End-of-Life by the end of last year, they still released patches for the three critical vulnerabilities CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974. Furthermore, as the device has reached End-of-Life, they decided to remove the "Remote Support" account "NsaRescueAngel".

CVE-2024-29975
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:46

1 posts

##

CVE-2024-4332(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-03T18:31:00

2 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified in the REST and SOAP API components of Tripwire Enterprise (TE) 9.1.0 when TE is configured to use LDAP/Active Directory SAML authentication and its optional "Auto-synchronize LDAP Users, Roles, and Groups" feature is enabled. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to bypass authentication if a valid username is known. Exploit

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T16:05:13.190Z ##

Fortra security advisory: Improper Authentication in Tripwire Enterprise 9.1 APIs
CVE-2024-4332 (9.8 critical, disclosed 03 June 2024) authentication bypass vulnerability in REST and SOAP API components of Tripwire Enterprise (TE) 9.1.0. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to bypass authentication if a valid username is known. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow remote attackers to gain privileged access to the APIs and lead to unauthorized information disclosure or modification. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_4332 #Tripwire #Fortra #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T13:18:55.000Z ##

Symantec: RansomHub: New Ransomware has Origins in Older Knight
Symantec assesses that RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) is very likely an updated and rebranded version of the older Knight ransomware. Analysis of the RansomHub payload by Symantec revealed a high degree of similarity between the two threats. RansomHub attackers gain initial access by exploiting the Zerologon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 Critical, disclosed 17 August 2020, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) IOC provided.

#zerologon #threatintel #IOC #ransomhub #Knightransomware #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.125Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

wvu@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-03T20:04:17.000Z ##

PSA: curl can do variables. Example using Nexus CVE-2024-4956:

curl -v --variable hax=////../../../../etc/passwd --expand-url http://127.0.0.2:8081/{{hax:url}}

https://everything.curl.dev/cmdline/variables.html

##

CVE-2024-30040
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.94%

updated 2024-05-14T18:31:15

1 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T11:42:26.000Z ##

Pozwólcie, że coś wyjaśnię, bo nie pierwszy już raz widzę takie kwiatki w serwisie dobreprogramy. Autor omawia majowe aktualizacje Microsoftu i narzeka na "CVSS z Księżyca" i rzekomą inflację w procesie szacowania skali zagrożenia. Chodzi m.in. o lukę CVE-2024-30040 w MSHTML, czyli w silniku Internet Explorera (mimo że sama przeglądarka z systemu została usunięta, to jej silnik nadal jest używany do renderowania zawartości webowej w dokumentach Office). W skali CVSS przyznano jej 8,8 pkt. - zdaniem autora o wiele za dużo, bo efektywne wykorzystanie luki wymaga od użytkownika samodzielnego pobrania i otwarcia złośliwego pliku, więc pff! gdzie tu wielkie zagrożenie? Szkopuł w tym, że właśnie ta luka jest już aktywnie używana w atakach - ktoś się nabiera, pobiera, otwiera i dochodzi do infekcji, czyli warto tę lukę w trybie pilnym załatać. Wypadałoby przed rozpoczęciem narzekania doczytać sobie to i owo.

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #microsoft

##

CVE-2024-3661
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-08T22:15:49.103000

2 posts

DHCP can add routes to a client’s routing table via the classless static route option (121). VPN-based security solutions that rely on routes to redirect traffic can be forced to leak traffic over the physical interface. An attacker on the same local network can read, disrupt, or possibly modify network traffic that was expected to be protected by the VPN.

1 repos

https://github.com/a1xbit/DecloakingVPN

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.956Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

##

CVE-2023-45288
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-02T18:59:06

2 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

1 repos

https://github.com/hex0punk/cont-flood-poc

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T22:45:43.737Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-15): CVE-2024-37279 (4.3 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue (note: DoS?)
  • Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-08) CVE-2023-45288 (aka HTTP/2 Continuation Flood, 5.4 medium, disclosed 03 April 2024) Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through HTTP/2 endpoints
  • Elasticsearch 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-13): CVE-2024-23445 (5.0 medium) Elasticsearch Remote Cluster Search Cross Cluster API Key insufficient restrictions

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_37279 #CVE_2024_23445 #CVE_2023_45288 #HTTP2 #continuationflood #CVE #vulnerability #Elastic #Kibana

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T22:45:43.000Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-15): CVE-2024-37279 (4.3 medium) Kibana Broken Access Control issue (note: DoS?)
  • Elastic Cloud Enterprise 3.7.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-08) CVE-2023-45288 (aka HTTP/2 Continuation Flood, 5.4 medium, disclosed 03 April 2024) Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through HTTP/2 endpoints
  • Elasticsearch 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-13): CVE-2024-23445 (5.0 medium) Elasticsearch Remote Cluster Search Cross Cluster API Key insufficient restrictions

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_37279 #CVE_2024_23445 #CVE_2023_45288 #HTTP2 #continuationflood #CVE #vulnerability #Elastic #Kibana

##

CVE-2024-27348
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-05-02T14:50:57

6 posts

RCE-Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server.This issue affects Apache HugeGraph-Server: from 1.0.0 before 1.3.0 in Java8 & Java11 Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.3.0 with Java11 & enable the Auth system, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

3 repos

https://github.com/kljunowsky/CVE-2024-27348

https://github.com/jakabakos/CVE-2024-27348-Apache-HugeGraph-RCE

https://github.com/Zeyad-Azima/CVE-2024-27348

AAKL at 2024-06-07T15:30:08.069Z ##

This was fixed with the Apache HugeGraph version 1.3.0 upgrade in April. #cybersecurity #infosec #opensource

POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw CVE-2024-27348 https://www.theregister.com/2024/06/07/poc_apache_hugegraph/ @theregister

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T02:13:53.157Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-27348 Apache HugeGraph
Note: SecureLayer7 miswrote the CVE ID in their own title. For all the attention to detail in their analysis, you would think they'd notice a CVE ID missing a number.
CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 April 2024 by Apache) Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server. An attacker can bypass the sandbox restrictions and achieve RCE through Gremlin, resulting in complete control over the server. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to understand the root cause (inadequate or missing reflections filtering in the SecurityManager). "This allowed us to access and manipulate various methods, ultimately enabling us to change the task/thread name to bypass all security checks. It was patched by filtering critical system classes and adding new security checks in HugeSecurityManager." Proof of Concept provided.

See related The Register article: POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_27348 #Apache #Hugegraph #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #Poc

##
DarkWebInformer at 2024-06-06T16:59:29.983Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨Apache HugeGraph Server RCE Scanner (CVE-2024-27348).

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE202427348 #Vulnerability

https://github.com/Zeyad-Azima/CVE-2024-27348

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1798761369623515326

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T02:13:53.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-27348 Apache HugeGraph
Note: SecureLayer7 miswrote the CVE ID in their own title. For all the attention to detail in their analysis, you would think they'd notice a CVE ID missing a number.
CVE-2024-27348 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 April 2024 by Apache) Remote Command Execution vulnerability in Apache HugeGraph-Server. An attacker can bypass the sandbox restrictions and achieve RCE through Gremlin, resulting in complete control over the server. SecureLayer7 performs patch diffing to understand the root cause (inadequate or missing reflections filtering in the SecurityManager). "This allowed us to access and manipulate various methods, ultimately enabling us to change the task/thread name to bypass all security checks. It was patched by filtering critical system classes and adding new security checks in HugeSecurityManager." Proof of Concept provided.

See related The Register article: POC exploit code published for 9.8-rated Apache HugeGraph RCE flaw

CVE-2024-26169
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2024-04-11T21:30:49

20 posts

Windows Error Reporting Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T14:53:48.367Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog (link might not work)
Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

#KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_26169 #CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_32896 #CISA #zeroday

##
threatcodex at 2024-06-12T13:23:31.057Z ##

Ransomware Attackers May Have Used Privilege Escalation Vulnerability as Zero-day
#CVE_2024_26169 #BlackBastaGroup
https://symantec-enterprise-blogs.security.com/threat-intelligence/black-basta-ransomware-zero-day

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T11:52:50.390Z ##

Symantec: Ransomware Attackers May Have Used Privilege Escalation Vulnerability as Zero-day
Symantec assesses that the financially motivated Cardinal group (aka Storm-1811, UNC4393) may have CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 March 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Error Reporting Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability as a zero day before it was publicly known and patched. Symantec notes that this group deploys Black Basta ransomware.

The variant of the tool used in this attack ... had a compilation time stamp of February 27, 2024, several weeks before the vulnerability was patched.
A second variant of the tool discovered on Virus Total ... had an earlier compilation time stamp of December 18, 2023.

Symantec provides IOC.

#CVE_2024_26169 #eitw #CVE #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #threatintel #IOC #ransomware #BlackBasta #Cardinal #Storm1811 #UNC4393

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T14:53:48.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

The security flaw in question is CVE-2024-26169 (CVSS score: 7.8), an elevation of privilege bug in the Windows Error Reporting Service that could be exploited to achieve SYSTEM privileges. ##

CVE-2019-6693
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-11T21:02:46

4 posts

Use of a hard-coded cryptographic key to cipher sensitive data in FortiOS configuration backup file may allow an attacker with access to the backup file to decipher the sensitive data, via knowledge of the hard-coded key. The aforementioned sensitive data includes users' passwords (except the administrator's password), private keys' passphrases and High Availability password (when set).

3 repos

https://github.com/synacktiv/CVE-2020-9289

https://github.com/gquere/CVE-2019-6693

https://github.com/saladandonionrings/cve-2019-6693

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.870Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-28916
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-11T20:15:35.637000

2 posts

Xbox Gaming Services Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T03:39:10.161Z ##

@chompie1337 Will you pull a "Filip Dragovic" and publicly release the vulnerability details and proof of concept? https://twitter.com/filip_dragovic/status/1767328563148231013?s=20 and https://github.com/Wh04m1001/GamingServiceEoP

He disclosed 11 March 2024 and Microsoft pushed out an out-of-band patch with a Publicly Disclosed flag for CVE-2024-28916 on 22 March: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-28916

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T03:39:10.000Z ##

@chompie1337 Will you pull a "Filip Dragovic" and publicly release the vulnerability details and proof of concept? https://twitter.com/filip_dragovic/status/1767328563148231013?s=20 and https://github.com/Wh04m1001/GamingServiceEoP

He disclosed 11 March 2024 and Microsoft pushed out an out-of-band patch with a Publicly Disclosed flag for CVE-2024-28916 on 22 March: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-28916

##

CVE-2024-29748
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-10T18:19:12

2 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T15:58:35.754Z ##

@jgreig According to GrapheneOS, CVE-2024-32896 is the 2nd part of the fix for the CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies: https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112609239806949074 h/t @caspicat cc: @jwarminsky

And that CVE-2024-32896 is not Pixel-specific

CVE-2023-4211
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 21.26%

updated 2024-04-04T07:59:36

2 posts

A local non-privileged user can make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.603Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

Summoning Team: Molding Lies Into Reality || Exploiting CVE-2024-4358
SinSinology of Summoning Team provides an exploit chain for CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical disclosed 29 May 2024 by Progress) Progress Telerik Report Server authentication bypass and CVE-2024-1800 (9.9 critical, disclosed 20 March 2024 by Progress) deserialization of untrusted data. The result is full pre-authenticated remote code execution. He provides a root cause analysis and a proof of concept.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T13:03:07.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-48788: Revisiting Fortinet FortiClient EMS to Exploit 7.2.X
Horizon3 concluded that their exploit from the previous deep-dive on CVE-2023-48788 (9.8 critical, disclosed 22 February 2024 by Fortinet, with proof of concept by Horizon3) only affected FortiClient EMS 7.0.x versions. They discuss the differences in exploitation between FortiClient EMS's two mainline versions: 7.0.x and 7.2.x. Horizon3 also includes insights into the issues surrounding the exploit development for CVE-2023-48788 to determine success.

https://github.com/back2root/log4shell-rex

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:32:59.347Z ##

Imperva: Update: CVE-2024-4577 quickly weaponized to distribute "TellYouThePass" Ransomware
From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

h/t: @BleepingComputer reporting: TellYouThePass ransomware exploits recent PHP RCE flaw to breach servers

#threatintel #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #ransomware #TellYouThePass #IOC

##

CVE-2023-50867
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-01-10T01:12:15.103000

4 posts

Travel Website v1.0 is vulnerable to multiple Unauthenticated SQL Injection vulnerabilities. The 'username' parameter of the signupAction.php resource does not validate the characters received and they are sent unfiltered to the database.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T18:33:47.765Z ##

@dreadpir8robots good catch, I guess 50868 doesn't have a designer name (but is related)

cc: @shellsharks CVE-2023-50867 is actually #KeyTrap stead of 50868

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.609Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T18:33:47.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots good catch, I guess 50868 doesn't have a designer name (but is related)

cc: @shellsharks CVE-2023-50867 is actually #KeyTrap stead of 50868

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-46604
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.14%

updated 2023-11-28T22:24:39

2 posts

Apache ActiveMQ is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution.The vulnerability may allow a remote attacker with network access to a broker to run arbitrary shell commands by manipulating serialized class types in the OpenWire protocol to cause the broker to instantiate any class on the classpath.  Users are recommended to upgrade to version 5.15.16, 5.16.7, 5.17.6, or 5.18.3, which fixes this issue.

Nuclei template

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T14:59:25.000Z ##

Aqua: Muhstik Malware Targets Message Queuing Services Applications
Aqua Nautilus discovered a new campaign of Muhstik malware targeting message queuing services applications such as Apache RocketMQ. The attackers downloaded Muhstik onto the compromised instances by exploiting CVE-2023-33246 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 May 2023 by Apache, added to KEV Catalog 06 September 2023. Apache RocketMQ Command Execution Vulnerability). Aqua describes the vulnerability exploitation, attacker actions on objective, and provide IOC.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:17:40.634Z ##

Mandiant and Google TAG: Insights on Cyber Threats Targeting Users and Enterprises in Brazil
Brazil is apparently a hotbed of cybercriminal and espionage activity due to its economy and influence in South America. Mandiant and Google Threat Analysis Group (TAG) talk about how China, Russia and North Korean state-sponsored actors target Brazil:

North Korean government-backed groups, for example, have shown a keen interest in Brazilian cryptocurrency firms, aerospace and defense, and government targets. PRC groups, meanwhile, have targeted Brazilian government organizations, as well as the energy sector. Russian cyber espionage groups have targeted users in Brazil regularly dating back more than a decade; however since the start of Russia’s war in Ukraine, Russian activity targeting Brazil has scaled back considerably

Mandiant and TAG also talk about Brazil's "unique cybercrime ecosystem": ransomware and data theft extortion as well as underground forum and social media advertisements for access to malicious insiders, databases, sensitive information, and specialized tools to compromise Brazilian users and institutions.

For the amount of information in this blog, the IOC is relatively light.

#Brazil #cybercrime #cyberespionage #threatintel #infostealer #UNC4841 #CVE_2022_41352 #UNC4899 #APT28 #GoPix #UNC5176 #URSA #Astaroth

##

CVE-2022-24834
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.34%

updated 2023-08-14T19:15:09.603000

2 posts

Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. A specially crafted Lua script executing in Redis can trigger a heap overflow in the cjson library, and result with heap corruption and potentially remote code execution. The problem exists in all versions of Redis with Lua scripting support, starting from 2.6, and affects only authenticated and authorized users. The problem is fixed in version

CVE-2022-38181
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 36.42%

updated 2023-06-21T05:01:11

2 posts

An Arm product family through 2022-08-12 mail GPU kernel driver allows non-privileged users to make improper GPU processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.603Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##

CVE-2023-27532
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 2.23%

updated 2023-03-16T18:30:29

2 posts

Vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication component allows encrypted credentials stored in the configuration database to be obtained. This may lead to gaining access to the backup infrastructure hosts.

2 repos

https://github.com/sfewer-r7/CVE-2023-27532

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-27532

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.125Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

CVE-2023-20938
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-03-14T05:06:51

1 posts

In binder_transaction_buffer_release of binder.c, there is a possible use after free due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-257685302References: Upstream kernel

CVE-2021-28663
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.63%

updated 2023-03-03T05:08:28

2 posts

The Arm Mali GPU kernel driver allows privilege escalation or information disclosure because GPU memory operations are mishandled, leading to a use-after-free. This affects Bifrost r0p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, Valhall r19p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, and Midgard r4p0 through r30p0.

##

CVE-2019-2054
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-02-28T20:47:18.963000

2 posts

In the seccomp implementation prior to kernel version 4.8, there is a possible seccomp bypass due to seccomp policies that allow the use of ptrace. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID: A-119769499

1 repos

#search_error

jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-06-06T13:53:19.000Z ##

@jpetazzo Hmm. 'ptrace' is included twice; once gated by kernel version >=4.8 (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L419), which addresses CVE-2019-2054, and one gated by CAP_SYS_PTRACE (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L739). So that seems ok for the default config, although I've seen people copy ungated 'ptrace' into the list of allowed calls, which at least opens up CVE-2019-2054 for vulnerable kernels.

But 'prctl' should allow you to change the filter itself, and 'seccomp' could be used to disable seccomp, I think?

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-06-06T13:53:19.000Z ##

@jpetazzo Hmm. 'ptrace' is included twice; once gated by kernel version >=4.8 (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L419), which addresses CVE-2019-2054, and one gated by CAP_SYS_PTRACE (https://github.com/moby/moby/blob/master/profiles/seccomp/default.json#L739). So that seems ok for the default config, although I've seen people copy ungated 'ptrace' into the list of allowed calls, which at least opens up CVE-2019-2054 for vulnerable kernels.

But 'prctl' should allow you to change the filter itself, and 'seccomp' could be used to disable seccomp, I think?

Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unaut

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) Oracle WebLogic Server OS Command Injection Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog based on evidence of active exploitation.

Shoutout to @hrbrmstr for the KEV Catalog RSS feed https://github.com/hrbrmstr/kev-push

screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.525Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.000Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##

CVE-2017-11882
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:36

6 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3, Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the current user by failing to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11884.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T11:47:16.938Z ##

ASEC: Keylogger Installed Using MS Office Equation Editor Vulnerability (Kimsuky)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) reports that the North Korean state actor Kimsuky exploited CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability to distribute a keylogger. Kimsuky leveraged the vulnerability to run a page with an embedded malicious script with the mshta process. IOC provided.

#Kimsuky #NorthKorea #cyberespionage #CVE_2017_11882 #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:04:25.374Z ##

Cofense: STR RAT – Phishing Malware Baseline
Cofense provides a rather high level overview of STR, a remote access trojan that is written in Java, and first observed in 2020. It receives near-annual updates which is noted by the uptick in its use by others. Cofense talks about its history, infection method, capabilities, and loaders. One of the loaders mentioned leverages CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Cofense does not provide hashes but their IOC consist of C2 addresses (and network/registry run key indicators).

#threatintel #STRrat #malwareanalysis #IOC #CVE_2017_11882

##

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T11:47:16.000Z ##

ASEC: Keylogger Installed Using MS Office Equation Editor Vulnerability (Kimsuky)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) reports that the North Korean state actor Kimsuky exploited CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability to distribute a keylogger. Kimsuky leveraged the vulnerability to run a page with an embedded malicious script with the mshta process. IOC provided.

#Kimsuky #NorthKorea #cyberespionage #CVE_2017_11882 #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T13:04:25.000Z ##

Cofense: STR RAT – Phishing Malware Baseline
Cofense provides a rather high level overview of STR, a remote access trojan that is written in Java, and first observed in 2020. It receives near-annual updates which is noted by the uptick in its use by others. Cofense talks about its history, infection method, capabilities, and loaders. One of the loaders mentioned leverages CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Cofense does not provide hashes but their IOC consist of C2 addresses (and network/registry run key indicators).

#threatintel #STRrat #malwareanalysis #IOC #CVE_2017_11882

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-07T15:34:29.000Z ##

Fortinet: New Agent Tesla Campaign Targeting Spanish-Speaking People
A new phishing campaign spreads a new Agent Tesla variant targeting Spanish-speaking people. The campaign leverages multiple techniques to deliver the Agent Tesla core module. The following vulnerabilities are exploited and mentioned in this blog:

  • CVE-2017-0199 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 April 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office/WordPad Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, in KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability

Fortinet describes the infection chain, provides technical analyses into the malware, and lists what sensitive information is stolen from victims and exfiltrated to an FTP server. IOC provided.

#agenttesla #malware #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2017_0199 #CVE_2017_11882 #eitw

##

CVE-2019-9082
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.45%

updated 2023-02-01T05:02:34

7 posts

ThinkPHP before 3.2.4, as used in Open Source BMS v1.1.1 and other products, allows Remote Command Execution via public//?s=index/\think\app/invokefunction&function=call_user_func_array&vars[0]=system&vars[1][]= followed by the command.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.000Z ##

Akamai: 2024: Old CVEs, New Targets — Active Exploitation of ThinkPHP
Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. The campaign seems to have started in as early as October 2023 by targeting a limited number of customers/organizations. It only recently became widespread. The attacks originated from various IP addresses associated with servers hosted on the "Zenlayer" cloud provider (ASN 21859), primarily located in Hong Kong. The exploit attempts to retrieve additional obfuscated code from another compromised ThinkPHP server to gain initial foothold. After successfully exploiting the system, the attackers will install a Chinese language web shell named Dama to maintain persistent access to the server. Subsequent actions may involve spreading further within the victim's data center or enlisting the server for use in attack infrastructure. No IOC.

#China #cyberespionage #threatintel #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2019_9082

##

CVE-2021-28664
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.42%

updated 2023-01-30T05:02:00

2 posts

The Arm Mali GPU kernel driver allows privilege escalation or a denial of service (memory corruption) because an unprivileged user can achieve read/write access to read-only pages. This affects Bifrost r0p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, Valhall r19p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, and Midgard r8p0 through r30p0.

1 repos

https://github.com/TAKIANFIF/CVE-2021-1905-CVE-2021-1906-CVE-2021-28663-CVE-2021-28664

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.603Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

EPSS: 2.48%

updated 2023-01-29T05:06:46

2 posts

. The Arm Mali GPU kernel driver allows an unprivileged user to achieve access to freed memory, leading to information disclosure or root privilege escalation. This affects Bifrost r16p0 through r29p0 before r30p0, Valhall r19p0 through r29p0 before r30p0, and Midgard r28p0 through r30p0.

CVE-2022-26500
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 3.43%

updated 2023-01-27T05:00:45

2 posts

Improper limitation of path names in Veeam Backup & Replication 9.5U3, 9.5U4,10.x, and 11.x allows remote authenticated users access to internal API functions that allows attackers to upload and execute arbitrary code.

1 repos

https://github.com/LeakIX/veeam-ds-client

screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.125Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

CVE-2018-20062
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.68%

updated 2020-04-14T18:15:11.970000

7 posts

An issue was discovered in NoneCms V1.3. thinkphp/library/think/App.php allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via crafted use of the filter parameter, as demonstrated by the s=index/\think\Request/input&filter=phpinfo&data=1 query string.

Akamai: 2024: Old CVEs, New Targets — Active Exploitation of ThinkPHP
Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. The campaign seems to have started in as early as October 2023 by targeting a limited number of customers/organizations. It only recently became widespread. The attacks originated from various IP addresses associated with servers hosted on the "Zenlayer" cloud provider (ASN 21859), primarily located in Hong Kong. The exploit attempts to retrieve additional obfuscated code from another compromised ThinkPHP server to gain initial foothold. After successfully exploiting the system, the attackers will install a Chinese language web shell named Dama to maintain persistent access to the server. Subsequent actions may involve spreading further within the victim's data center or enlisting the server for use in attack infrastructure. No IOC.

CVE-2024-380083
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T20:29:06.196Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) dropped 21 security advisories related to Microsoft Edge and Chromium-based vulnerabilities. For convenience, I will not link all of the ones already disclosed by Google Chrome from 11 June 2024 (see parent toot above). Instead, I will list the new ones:

  • CVE-2024-30057 (CVSS:3.1 5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge for iOS Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-30058 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38083 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

The other CVEs match those disclosed by Google on Tuesday. None of the above Microsoft Edge-specific vulnerabilities were marked as publicly disclosed or exploited. None of Google Chrome's CVEs were noted to have an exploit in the wild either.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #Chrome #Chromium #Edge #CVE_2024_30057 #CVE_2024_30058 #CVE_2024_380083

Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-03T18:18:25.045Z ##

Summoning Team: Molding Lies Into Reality || Exploiting CVE-2024-4358
SinSinology of Summoning Team provides an exploit chain for CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical disclosed 29 May 2024 by Progress) Progress Telerik Report Server authentication bypass and CVE-2024-1800 (9.9 critical, disclosed 20 March 2024 by Progress) deserialization of untrusted data. The result is full pre-authenticated remote code execution. He provides a root cause analysis and a proof of concept.

h/t: @BleepingComputer Exploit for critical Progress Telerik auth bypass released, patch now cc: @cR0w

#CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_1800 #Progress #Telerik #vulnerability #proofofconcept #POC

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T14:53:48.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog (link might not work)
Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

#KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_26169 #CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_32896 #CISA #zeroday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-03T18:18:25.000Z ##

Summoning Team: Molding Lies Into Reality || Exploiting CVE-2024-4358
SinSinology of Summoning Team provides an exploit chain for CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical disclosed 29 May 2024 by Progress) Progress Telerik Report Server authentication bypass and CVE-2024-1800 (9.9 critical, disclosed 20 March 2024 by Progress) deserialization of untrusted data. The result is full pre-authenticated remote code execution. He provides a root cause analysis and a proof of concept.

h/t: @BleepingComputer Exploit for critical Progress Telerik auth bypass released, patch now cc: @cR0w

#CVE_2024_4358 #CVE_2024_1800 #Progress #Telerik #vulnerability #proofofconcept #POC

aeveltstra@mastodon.social at 2024-06-04T21:52:19.000Z ##

https://summoning.team/blog/progress-report-server-rce-cve-2024-4358-cve-2024-1800/

When a #cybersecurity expert manages to escalate a wrongly-classified #cve into a correct classification, we find a bug in #Progress that allows for arbitrary remote code execution by an unprivileged user.

#cve20244358 #cve20241800 #rce

New listings on #CISA. #cybersecurity #infosec #Google

KEV catalogue:

- CVE-2024-32896 (patched): #Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32896

- CVE-2024-26169: #Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-26169

(More info: Microsoft on CVE-2024-26169: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-26169)

- CVE-2024-4358: Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4358

- Siemens SCALANCE W700 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-165-12
- Siemens TIA Administrator https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/ics-advisories/icsa-24-165-03

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-07T18:47:38.543Z ##

@censys I read your advisory and wanted to emphasize that SinSinology published what appears to be a weaponized exploit chain for CVE-2024-4358 and CVE-2024-1800 https://github.com/sinsinology/CVE-2024-4358

Shadowserver reporting exploitation attempts: https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112568641063171625

We are observing Progress Telerik Report Server CVE-2024-4358 auth bypass exploitation attempts in our honeypot sensors starting 5th June. We have also started reporting out vulnerable versions seen in our scans (89 seen on 5th June out of 95 exposed).

##

CVE-2024-3938
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T13:10:55.126Z ##

Kaspersky: QR code SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in a popular biometric terminal
Biometric scanners have their own sorts of vulnerabilities, and Kaspersky gives us a rundown: overview of biometric terminals, their pros and cons, physical inspection and reverse engineering of a specific terminal (including network and camera/QR code scanning analysis), and identifying its vulnerabilities. Their analysis of the ZKTeco biometric terminal yielded 24 vulnerabilities:

  • 6 SQL injection vulnerabilities;
  • 7 buffer stack overflow vulnerabilities;
  • 5 command injection vulnerabilities;
  • 4 arbitrary file write vulnerabilities;
  • 2 arbitrary file read vulnerabilities.

These vulnerability types are reflected in CVEs ranging from CVE-2024-3938 through CVE-2024-3943.

#vulnerability #biometric #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T13:10:55.000Z ##

Kaspersky: QR code SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in a popular biometric terminal
Biometric scanners have their own sorts of vulnerabilities, and Kaspersky gives us a rundown: overview of biometric terminals, their pros and cons, physical inspection and reverse engineering of a specific terminal (including network and camera/QR code scanning analysis), and identifying its vulnerabilities. Their analysis of the ZKTeco biometric terminal yielded 24 vulnerabilities:

  • 6 SQL injection vulnerabilities;
  • 7 buffer stack overflow vulnerabilities;
  • 5 command injection vulnerabilities;
  • 4 arbitrary file write vulnerabilities;
  • 2 arbitrary file read vulnerabilities.

These vulnerability types are reflected in CVEs ranging from CVE-2024-3938 through CVE-2024-3943.

#vulnerability #biometric #cve

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T13:10:55.000Z ##

Kaspersky: QR code SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in a popular biometric terminal
Biometric scanners have their own sorts of vulnerabilities, and Kaspersky gives us a rundown: overview of biometric terminals, their pros and cons, physical inspection and reverse engineering of a specific terminal (including network and camera/QR code scanning analysis), and identifying its vulnerabilities. Their analysis of the ZKTeco biometric terminal yielded 24 vulnerabilities:

  • 6 SQL injection vulnerabilities;
  • 7 buffer stack overflow vulnerabilities;
  • 5 command injection vulnerabilities;
  • 4 arbitrary file write vulnerabilities;
  • 2 arbitrary file read vulnerabilities.

These vulnerability types are reflected in CVEs ranging from CVE-2024-3938 through CVE-2024-3943.

(0 None)

harrysintonen at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.289Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

##
harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.000Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

jbhall56 at 2024-06-07T12:39:46.844Z ##

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-24919, affects software in multiple versions of Check Point's CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, and Quantum Spark appliances. All the affected products are Check Point security gateways with IPsec VPN functionality. https://www.darkreading.com/cyberattacks-data-breaches/attacks-surge-on-check-points-recent-vpn-zero-day-flaw

##

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-01T22:30:47.000Z ##

IoT search engine Censys is seeing almost 14,000 Check Point security gateways connected to the internet: https://censys.com/cve-2024-24919/

The devices may be vulnerable to CVE-2024-24919, a zero-day in the company's devices that was patched last week: https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336
